messages.content: You are a helpful assistant.
What is the primary use of the Mechanical Repair skill?
To open common household locks
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the relationship between Mechanical Repair and Electrical Repair?
Both are companion skills and may be necessary to fix complex devices
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the difference between Regular difficulty and Hard difficulty in Mechanical Repair?
Regular difficulty involves repairing or creating a simple device, while Hard difficulty involves repairing a damaged device or creating a complex device with limited resources
You are a helpful assistant.
What can be a consequence of failing a Pushed roll in Mechanical Repair?
You have broken the device beyond repair; you hurt yourself while working on the device; you become obsessed with the device and spend excessive time working on it
You are a helpful assistant.
What can this skill be used to open?
common household locks
You are a helpful assistant.
What is Mechanical Repair a companion skill to?
Electrical Repair
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the regular difficulty level for Mechanical Repair?
repair or create a simple device
You are a helpful assistant.
What can happen if an insane investigator fails a pushed roll?
he or she fills a telephone directory-sized notepad with scribbled designs
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the primary function of the Medicine skill?
The Medicine skill diagnoses and treats accidents, injuries, diseases, poisonings, etc., and makes public health recommendations.
You are a helpful assistant.
How long does a Medicine treatment take a minimum?
A minimum of one hour
You are a helpful assistant.
What happens to a character's hit points after successful Medicine treatment?
1D3 hit points (in addition to any First Aid they have received)
You are a helpful assistant.
What must be done to a dying character before a Medicine roll can be made?
Successful First Aid to stabilize them
You are a helpful assistant.
How long does a treatment of Medicine take?
a minimum of one hour
You are a helpful assistant.
What happens to a character's hit points after a successful Medicine treatment?
1D3 hit points, in addition to any First Aid received
You are a helpful assistant.
Can a character receive Medicine treatment multiple times before further damage is taken?
No, except in the case of a dying character
You are a helpful assistant.
What does successful Medicine treatment do to an unconscious person?
Rouse them to consciousness
You are a helpful assistant.
What does the Medicine skill grant knowledge of?
a wide variety of drugs and potions, natural and man-made
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the minimum time required for a successful Medicine treatment?
one hour
You are a helpful assistant.
What happens if Medicine is not performed on the same day as damage?
the difficulty level is increased (requiring a Hard success)
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the recovery reward for successful Medicine treatment of Major Wounds?
a Bonus die on their weekly recovery roll
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the Keeper's power in granting success for medical treatment?
The Keeper may grant automatic success for medical treatment in a contemporary, well-equipped hospital.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the difficulty level of diagnosing and treating standard medical ailments?
Regular difficulty: diagnosis and treatment of standard medical ailments, with access to equipment (at least a doctor’s bag containing drugs and instruments) and a suitable environment.
You are a helpful assistant.
What are some examples of pushing the limits in a medical treatment roll?
Consulting with colleagues; conducting further research; trying something experimental or more risky; performing some form of clinical experiment.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the consequence of failing a Pushed Medicine roll when a character is dying?
In the case of a dying character, if a Pushed Medicine roll is failed, the patient dies.
You are a helpful assistant.
What happens if an investigator fails a Pushed roll?
The results will be disturbing in the extreme, perhaps involving amputations
You are a helpful assistant.
What type of roll is being referred to in the text?
a Pushed roll
You are a helpful assistant.
What could the investigator be investigating if they fail the roll?
an insane investigator
You are a helpful assistant.
What could be the result of the investigator failing the roll?
disturbing results, perhaps involving amputations
